That is why he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy what he needs for his store, such as snacks, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, beverages, etc. He is certain he can pay off the debt and also trusts that it will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Isabel De La Paz

texts.es: Isabel de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 33 años de edad quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, Ella posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, y sus ganancias han aumentado es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra tener junto a su hijo seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Isabel, 58, lives in her own home with her 33-year-old son who works and helps with household expenses. She has a business selling various styles of clothing for all people: men, women, and children. The clothes she sells are a very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices.

She decided to request a loan from Integral so she can buy a variety of skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, and suits. This will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that this will bring her and her son financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, and suits.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: teodoro vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, el quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Teodoro tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teodoro lives in his own home with his wife. He has a store where he sells basic necessity products such as beans, milk, eggs, and bread. He has had this business for many years and it has provided him with experience in sales, which allows him to earn more income. The store is located in his home, which is a busy area. He has gained many customers because he has the most well-stocked store. People prefer him and support him as opposed to the competition because he always has what they need, and they are good quality products with affordable prices. His service is unbeatable, and he is always at his customers' service.

Teodoro wants to grow his business and make a new investment but he needs capital, so he is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow him to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, and drinks. Teodoro has good credit references, and he assures lenders that he will pay off his debt. Also, he says that this will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, and drinks.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora,  vive con su esposo y su hijo. Maria está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Maria is 59 years old. She has worked in agriculture for several years, growing corn and beans. With the sales of her crops she is able to pay for her household expenses. She is a responsible, honest and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and child. Maria is asking for a loan to be able to buy harvest materials, such as fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pest control, etc. What she earns isn't enough to cover these expenses and this way she will have better income and more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, sus hijos y su suegra, el se dedica a la venta de conchas(mariscos) lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de conchas(mariscos) por mayor para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y asi podra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client lives in his own house with his life's companion, their children and his mother in law. He sells mollusks (seafood) as a street vendor in the different neighborhoods near to his residence. With what he earns from his sales, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. The client is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy the mollusks (seafood) wholesale in order to continue with his work, because it is his only source of income and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mollusks (seafood) wholesale.

loans.name: Jessica Liduvina

texts.es: Jessica de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 15 años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, Jessica tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Jessica is 34 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her two children in her own home. She has sold clothes for 15 years and this has given her a lot of experience which allows her to obtain the best profits. The business is located in her residence. She has gained a lot of customers because people know that everything is quality at accessible prices and with unmatched service always to the orders and tastes of the customers. During the last few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage with a new investment, but she doesn't have enough capital to back her up. That is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy her clothes wholesale. Jessica has good payment references and unimpeachable morals. She is sure that she can pay off the debt and at the same time, she hopes to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Neris Yaneth

texts.es: Neris de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia tiene 4 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias,es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como golosinas, granos basicos, aceite, arroz, azucar, refrescos, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Neris is 34 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has had a small store in her residence for 4 years. This has given her a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to obtain the best profits. She is very well known to the area residents and has gained a lot of customers because she has a well stocked store. She wants to grow her business and make a new investment, but he needs capital. That is why she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store, such as snacks, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, beverages, etc. She is certain she can pay off the debt and she is confident it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, basic grains, oil, rice, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 años y  3 años de edad. José es un hombre trabajador y responsable quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para pavimentar el piso del corredor de la vivienda.
texts.en: José is 41 years old. He lives in his own home with his life's companion and their two children, aged 9 and 3. José is a hardworking and responsible man who does everything within his reach to give his children what they need. He works buying and selling cattle and earns a living this way and supports the home. He wants to improve the living conditions in his home and that is why he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, and gravel to pave the floor of the corridor of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to pave the floor of the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, electrodes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish paying for a pig, to pay off a television, and to buy school supplies for his children

loans.name: Botirali

texts.ru: Ботирали житель района Джаббор Расулова города Худжанд. Он 47-летний женатый человек, имеющий троих детей в возрасте 12, 15 и 16 лет. Ботирали в семье главный добытчик. Он параллельно занимается растениеводством и животноводством. Ботирали занят в этих сферах более 15 лет. У него большой опыт как в выращивании сельскохозяйственных культур, так и в разведении крупнорогатого скота. Ему помогает в работе его рабочий и семья. Ботирали на своем участке уже провел посевные работы. Ему теперь нужны минеральные удобрения для обработки, чтобы весной он мог получить качественный и богатый урожай. К тому же ему необходимо увеличить поголовье скота для развития своего бизнеса по животноводству. Для осуществления этих целей, к сожалению у Ботилари нет достаточных средств. В связи с этим он обратился за кредитом и полагается на Вашу поддержку. Этот кредит ему очень важен.
texts.en:
Botirali is a resident of the Djabbor Rasulov region of the city of Khujand.  He is 47, married and has three children aged 12, 15 and 16 respectively.  Botirali is the breadwinner of the family and works as a crop and livestock farmer.  He's been plying both trades for more than 15 years, and has a lot of experience in growing crops and raising cattle.  He has a hired hand who helps him tend to the farm, and his family contributes as well.

Botirali has already finish sowing his crops for the season, and needs mineral fertilizers to increase the quality of his harvest this spring.  He also needs to buy more cattle to help grow his livestock-raising business.  At the moment, he currently lacks the money to buy either one and is thus seeking a loan.  This loan is crucial for him, and he's counting on your support.

loans.use: buy mineral fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Teresa Viviana

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 13 y 8 años y un bebé  de 8  meses, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en mantenimiento de maquinarias.
Doña Teresa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar instalo un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos así como también  ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella vende en su local y también sale a ofrecer puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días,  la mercadería la va a comprar cada quince días a Guayaquil o cuando  necesita. Lleva  9  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y cosméticos.  Lleva 9 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito emprendió su negocio. Sus sueños es tener un carro para realizar sus recorridos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas lending group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the Coffee Sultan because of its extensive coffee crops with a unique flavor, for its food, and for the warmth of its people.

Teresa lives here.  She is 31 years old, married, and has four children ages 14, 13, 8, and an eight month old baby.  The two oldest attend high school and the youngest is in school.  Her husband maintains machines.

She sells from her shop and also sells door to door on credit and collects every week.  She buys her items every two weeks, or as needed, in Guayaquil.  She has been doing this for nine years and things are going well for her.

Teresa, in order to earn something on her own and help her husband with the household expenses, she opened a small shop in her home, where she sells all types of products, such as clothing of all types, and Esika (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and cosmetics.  She has been with the lending group for nine years and started her business with the money from her first loan.  Her dream is to have a car so she can make more trips.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Patila

texts.ru: Патиле 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 2 детей. Свою трудовую деятельность начала с детского сада, работала в качестве няни. С 1992 года Патила начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды (платья, блузки, нижнее белье, куртки, спортивные костюмы), стартовав с суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), Патила сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 20,000 сом (KGS). За товаром на оптовые рынки ездит сама. Супруг работает в управлении муниципальной собственности и развития туризма, в качестве специалиста отдела градостроительства. Получает ежемесячную зарплату. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Патила обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом. Патила планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем намерена собрать денежные средства в помощь сыну при покупке квартиры.
texts.en:
Patila is 50 years old and married, and raises two children with her spouse. Her working life got its start at the kindergarten: she used to work as a nanny. In 1992 Patila switched to the women's clothing sector (dresses, blouses, underwear, jackets and activewear), starting her business with an investment of 10,000 som (KGS). She has managed to grow her business with its monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS). She goes to the wholesale markets to purchase her merchandise herself. 

Her spouse works in the municipal property and tourism development administration, as a professional for the city planning department. He earns a monthly salary. 

Patila has applied to the "Bai Tushum" Bank for a loan with the intention of broadening her selection of goods. Patila plans to save the income from the business to further improve her inventory in the future, but also is determined to build the financial means to help her son buy an apartment in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell retail

loans.name: Erledys

texts.es:
La historia de erledys  surge por la necesidad de obtener mejor atención medica por parte del centro de salud del pueblo donde vivía,  ella notaba que no  era insuficiente la atención de aquel centro médico, por lo cual decidió estudiar medicina, está estudiando esta cerrera Porque le gusta todo lo que tiene que ver con la salud pública, como era una persona de bajos recursos  no le alcanzaba para cancelar el semestre, necesita el subsidio con kiva por motivos económicos, ya que es madre soltera y no tiene el apoyo familiar para poder culminar con éxito la carrera.  
A pesar de todo lo anterior y de la negligencia en el medio de la salud, a ella le interesa todo lo que tiene que ver con esta cerrara, le interesa  todo lo de la salud  para ayudar  e  implementar una mejor calidad en el servicio de la salud.
texts.en: The story of Erledys arises from the need to obtain better medical care from the health center in the town where she lived.  She felt that the care in that medical center was not adequate, therefore she decided to study medicine.  She is studying this career because she likes everything that has to do with public health.  As she was a person of little resources she wasn’t going to be able to pay for the semester.  She needs the loan from Kiva for financial reasons as she is a single mother and she doesn’t have the family support to be able to successfully complete her courses.  Despite all of the above and the negligence in the healthcare environment, she is interested in everything that has to do with this field.  She is interested in everything that has to do with health in order to help and to implement better quality health services.

loans.use: to pay for a semester’s tuition.

loans.name: Sandra Viviana

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer luchadora y carismática, nacida en el seno de una familia campesina y humilde, pero, con el ánimo de encontrar mejores oportunidades para progresar salió de su pueblo natal y se radicó en la ciudad. Allí se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, la cual tomó sin tener experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio, sin embargo, con empeño, dedicación y perseverancia logró aprender rápidamente y ya lleva 3 años en funcionamiento, logrando un reconocimiento en el sector. De esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de surtido para la tienda, al por mayor (mecato, granos, salsas, lácteos, carnes frías, entre otros), buscando beneficios por los bajos costos, así podrá mejorar la variedad de artículos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, además aumentará su nivel de rentabilidad.
Sandra manifiesta que su propósito es seguir trabajando para acreditar su negocio y en un futuro cercano, desea ampliarlo y así mejorar la rentabilidad, para que le garantice una estabilidad económica y así brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a fighting and charismatic woman. Although born into a family of the countryside with humble conditions, with the aim of finding better opportunities to improve she left her birth town and resettled in the city. There she was presented with the opportunity to acquire a small grocery store, which she did without having any experience in running this type of business. Nonetheless, with determination, dedication and preservation she was able to learn quickly and has already been in operation for three year, achieving industry recognition. Through this store, she generates the resources necessary to support her husband with the financial responsibilities of their home. 

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of stock for the store. Buying items at wholesale such as pastries, grains, sauces, dairies, meats, etc. she will look for the benefits of lower costs, which will allow her to improve the variety of items to satisfy the needs of her customers and also increase her level of profitability. 

Sandra states that her intention is to continue working to establish her business and in the near future she wishes to expand it so that she can improve the profitability to guarantee economic stability and thus provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock such as pastries, grains, sauces, dairies, cold meats, etc. at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida de 42 años de edad, no estudio ella es casada, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos  maíz, frijol y en ocasiones trabajando como auxiliar de albañilería. Tienen 5 hijos, la primera trabaja de doméstica en la ciudad, el segundo  estudia primer año de bachillerato, la tercera estudia séptimo grado, los demás educación básica en la escuela del cantón, solo ellos y su esposo viven con ella.

Cándida solo recibe ayuda económica de su hija mayor y de su esposo.

Manifiesta que con el crédito pagara $ 200.00 que debe y con el resto comprara zapatos para dos de sus hijos. El crédito mejorara su calidad de vida, ayudara a solventar las deudas  y quedarse trabajando con credicampo, sabe el plan de pago que le queda establecido es mensualmente. 

   Cándida sueña en ayudar a  sus hijos a que sean bachilleres por lo menos, para que así tengan la facilidad de encontrar un trabajo adecuado y que puedan  depender de sus mismos ingresos, el crédito le ayudara a que cumpla las obligaciones de sus hijos, comprándoles los zapatos y más.
texts.en:
Candida, 42, did not go to school.  She is married, and her husband is a farmer who cultivates staple grains like corn and beans.  At times he also works as a bricklayer.  They have 5 children.  The eldest works as a domestic in the city, the second oldest is in her first year of high school, their third child is in 7th grade, and the others all attend the local elementary school.  She lives only with her children and her husband.  

Candida receives financial support from her oldest daughter and her husband.  She states that with this loan she will pay off a debt of $200, and with the rest she will buy shoes for two of her children.  This loan will improve her quality of life.  It will help her to pay off debt, and enable her to continue to work with CREDICAMPO; she understands that she is agreeing to a monthly payment plan.  

Candida dreams of helping her children to at least finish high school so that they can easily find suitable jobs that will generate reliable income.  This loan will help her to fulfill her obligations to her children, enabling her to purchase shoes and other items.

loans.use: to pay off a debt and buy shoes for her children

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. Двое старших сыновей работают в Москве, ежемесячно высылают часть своей зарплаты родителям в Кыргызстан. Супруг работает в государственной автоинспекции. Сама Индира-домохозяйка. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Индира занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Индиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 3 бычка, 18 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en: Indira is 41, married and raising 3 sons with her husband.  Her two oldest sons work in Moscow and send money back home to their parents in Kyrgyzstan every month.  Indira's husband works in traffic enforcement, while she herself tends to their home and raises livestock for a living.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and first started raising livestock nearly 23 years ago with 5,000 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has 2 dairy cows, 2 horses, 3 bull calves and 18 sheep, while her monthly income is nearly 15,000 som.  To further develop her farm, Indira is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy some cows.  She plans on setting aside any extra money that the loan will allow her to make to buy a new car for her family.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia previously accessed a 39,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alicia dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
This is Glenda, 47, a resident of GMA, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Oscar, a driver, and is the mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide an income for her everyday expenses.  

Glenda oversees and manages the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers is the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Glenda hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family will have a vacation. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Alejandra Eduvis

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alejandra, tiene 77 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Alejandra es una mujer que a pesar de su edad siempre le ha gustado trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en un mercado local, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, así como legumbres y frutas, sus hijas le ayudan con su negocio cuando ella no puede pero por lo general ella está siempre en su negocio ya que se entretiene y está cerca de su querido esposo que también tiene un puesto de frutas y legumbres en el mismo mercado,  lleva más de 16 años con su negocio el cual comenzó con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres, frutas y legumbres. Está en el Grupo de Crédito 17 años  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos instalo su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y no tener que pagar en arriendos que se le llevan buenas partes de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas lending group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the Coffee Sultan because of its extensive coffee crops with a unique flavor, for its food, and for the warmth of its people.

Alejandra lives here.  She is 77 years old, married, and has seven adult children; two of them still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

Alejandra is a lady who, despite her age, has always liked working so she could help her husband get ahead.  She has a food store in the local market where she sells all types of personal products such as fruits and vegetables and her daughters help her when she can’t be there, but generally she is always there because she has fun and gets to be near her husband, who also has a fruit and vegetable stand in the same market.  She has had her business for more than 16 years, which she started with one of the loans she got from the institution.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her store with food, fruit, and vegetables.  She has been with the lending group for 17 years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with one of the loans.  Her dream are to have her own shop and not have to pay rent, which eats up part of her profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Wilder Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Wilder Alexander se encuentra matriculado en campo alto en el  área de hotelería turismo. 
Por lo  tanto el se dirige a ustedes para requerir del convenio y ayuda con el convenio de kiva  ya que la mamá no cuenta con los recursos económicos para costear la carrera técnica. 
El es un joven con deseos de superación y así ayudar a la mamá económicamente ya que él tiene dos hermanas y una de ellas tiene discapacidad múltiple.
Ante todo agradezco la atención y la colaboración le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
The young Wilder Alexander is enrolled in Campo Alto studying hospitality tourism.
For this reason he reaches out to you to ask for an agreement and help with the Kiva agreement since his mother does not have the economic resources to afford his technical degree. 
He is a young man with the hopes of succeeding and in this way help his mom financially as he has two sisters and one of them has multiple disabilities.
Foremost, he is thankful for the attention and collaboration that Kiva can provide him.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Jovelyn, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, a painter and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jovelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jovelyn dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her family is always in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador de 71 años de edad, es un agricultor que no logro estudiar debido a que sus padres no lo pudieron mandar a estudiar, sino que lo mandaron desde muy pequeño a trabajar. Actualmente está casado y tiene un hijo el cual ya no vive con él desde hace muchos años, su hijo también se casó y se fue a vivir muy lejos y con ellos solo vive un nieto, él vive con él por la distancia a la escuela dejo de estudiar.

Salvador desde pequeño le inculcaron la agriculturas esa es su actividad, a la cual se dedica desde que tenía 10 años de edad, esto lo logro aprender gracias a sus padres ahora el cultiva 14000 metros cuadrados, que el renta cada año en los meses de enero o febrero para ir preparando, él se levanta muy temprano para ir ver la cosecha cuando esta cultivada.
Salvador invertirá su crédito en la siembra de 14000 metros cuadrado, de maíz los fondos que el posee no le alcanzan para eso solicito el crédito  y con la ganancia que obtenga  podrá ayudar a su familia a seguir adelante.
Salvador sueña que en un tiempo su nieto logre graduarse del bachillerato, ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad cuando era joven, ahora él quisiera poder lograr que su nieto se prepare mejor, sabe que lo podrá lograr con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Salvador is 71 years old. He is a farmer who wasn't able to go to school as his parents couldn't afford to send him. Instead they led him to work at a young age. He is married and has a son who hasn't lived with them for many years. His son is also married and went off to live a long ways away. Only a grandson lives with them as they are close enough to a school for him to study. 

Salvador was taught about farming at a very early age. He started to work when he was 10 years old. His parents taught him and today he cultivates 14,000 square meters that he rents. Each year in January and February he prepares the land. He gets up very early to care for his crops while they are growing. 

Salvador will invest the loan to plant the 14,000 square meters with corn. He does not have enough money to do this so he is requesting the loan. With the profits he can help his family get ahead. Salvador hopes that one day his grandson will graduate as he never had this opportunity as a youth. So he wants his grandson to be better prepared. He knows he can achieve this with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to grow 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her store buying more products.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Nenita would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to purchase products and raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and to cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Agripina would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Agripina dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol is a married woman with three children. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and she is a factory laborer. Both of them can make $7 per day. 

In order to build up her family’s standard of living, Chanthol would like to access a loan of $1,000 USD to buy a TukTuk (motor cycle) for her husband to run public transportation and make more income. Furthermore, she would like to run a small business, build a wooden house, and give her kids a higher education in the future.

loans.use: to buy a TukTuk for her husband to run public transportation

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn is married and has one child. She and her husband are rice soup sellers, earning $6 per day. Their daughter is a factory labor who earns $3 per day.  

In order to improve her business, Yoeurn is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to enlarge her small store.

loans.use: to enlarge her small store

loans.name: Kim Chhieng

texts.en:
Kim Chhieng is 58 years old, widowed, and has two children. Her daughter is a factory labor and her son is a solider. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. To earn a living, she runs a grocery store, earning $11 per day.

Kim Chhieng would like to enlarge her grocery store, so she is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy more drinks in order to reach more customers.  In the future, she hopes she can build a gate for her house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta used her previous loan to buy more merchandise for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also sells ready-to-wear products for additional income.
 
Julieta is requesting another loan for 32,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits, which will help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. 

Julieta hopes that her business will last long. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vanden

texts.en:
Vanden is a 31-year-old  married woman with one child. 

She is a factory laborer and her husband is a Tuk-tuk (motor cycle) driver. Both of them can make $11.80 per day. She would like to ask for loan of $1,500 to buy an iron and wood to build a house. She would like to make her house a little better to live in. She wants to  build the house and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy an iron and wood to build a house.

loans.name: Sultonposha

texts.ru: Султонпоше 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Дочь замужем, оба сына женаты, проживают вместе с родителями, помогают родителям по хозяйству. У Султонпоши - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Султонпоша занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Султонпоши, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,36 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу и хлопок. У Султонпоши есть большой опыт в сельском хозяйстве. Ежегодно дважды в год для минимизации рисков заболевания и падежа скота, с помощью ветеринара делаются прививки. Корма и сено заготовлено. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Султонпоша обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Султонпоша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en:
Sultonposha is 48, married and raising 3 children together with her husband.  Her daughter is married, as well as both of her sons.  Tthey all live with their parents and help them tend to the family farm.  Sultonposha has the equivalent of a high school education and is a crop and livestock farmer by trade, first starting 25 years ago with 2,400 som worth of animals.  Thanks to her persistence, she currently has a dairy cow, 10 sheep and a 0.36 hectare plot of land for growing potatoes, corn and cotton.  She has feed and hay cut and prepared for her animals, and her monthly income is currently 10,000 som.  She has a lot of experience as a farmer, and, with the help of a veterinarian, vaccinates her animals twice yearly to prevent disease and death.

To further develop her farm, Sultonposha is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy cows for fattening and resale at a high price.  She plans on using any extra money that the loan allows her to make to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to set aside money to buy a new family car.

loans.use: buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is a 48-year-old widowed woman with two children. She is a fish retailer and her eldest child works in a factory. They can earn $10.8 per day. She would like to apply for loan to buy land and a house. This loan will also be used for her business. Her business and family can benefit  from this loan. 

She especially hopes that her youngest child can graduate from university in the future.

loans.use: to purchase land and a house.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a married and has one child. She is a hairdresser and her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $10 per day.

Yen is requesting a loan for $1,500, which she will use to buy a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service. With the loan, he will earn a larger income   to support her family. In the future, she wants to renovate her house and see her child get a diploma and a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins and sheets of galvanized metal

loans.name: Yath

texts.en:
Yath is a married woman with two children. She is a khmer cake seller. She can make around $3 per day. Her eldest child works in Korea as a laborer and he can make $67 per day. 

Yath would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials for building a gate. This gate will be helpful for protecting her house and her crop. Furthermore, she would like to enlarge her small business and to encourage her youngest child to get a diploma in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a gate

loans.name: Mirlan

texts.en:
Mirlan is a freshman in AUCA's Software Engineering Department and this is his story.

“I want to be an IT specialist. My hobby is to learn about the new machines and new computer programs. Usually I follow the related news on TV and in the modern magazines.  I network with a lot of IT friends who share  their work experiences and opinions on this topic. One of my future goals is to create my own company in Kyrgyzstan and produce computer  programs. It can help people to solve their problems using it in their community as a social network.

I have loved mathematics since my childhood and was one of the best math students  at school.  I think that math is very interesting and easy. According to my math teacher, I could be a brilliant engineer or technician.

I chose AUCA because it is an outstanding university of Central Asia.  It has professional teachers and a modern computer laboratory. The American system of education also can help me to become one of the best  computer engineering professionals.  AUCA has prepared  famous programmers of my country and I want to be one of them and make AUCA proud.”

loans.use: to pay tuition for a higher education.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun is a 43-year-old woman. She is a farmer and she can earn $1 per day. She lives with her three siblings. Two siblings can earn $11 per day. 

Due to a lack of money for building a house for her siblings, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500.  In the future, she is going to try harder in her field and to continue renovating her house.

loans.use: to build a house for her siblings

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, 49 years of age, is married to a farmer. The couple has been blessed with four children. Gloria owns and runs a variety store selling goods for daily consumption, like soap, shampoo and breads. Meanwhile, her children attend school. 

Gloria’s dream is to become a better entrepreneur someday, so she can invest in another business as an additional source of income. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more grocery items, like soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and food seasonings. She is hoping to obtain her requested loan for further improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her general store

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz is a freshman in the Sociology Program at AUCA. This is his story.

“I am from Kyrgyzstan. There have been 2 revolutions over the last 10 years and 2 presidents have been ousted in the capital Bishkek.The revolutions were followed by increased ethnic tension in the south of the country, which escalated in June 2010. The violence ultimately led to the consolidation of a new parliamentary system in Kyrgyzstan. Fortunately, there is peace and tranquility now. But those 2 events and their repercussions made the citizens of my country  think about the future, be incredulous to power, and become instilled with a fear that it may happen again in future. I am interested in searching and learning about  themes such as nationality and ethnicity, social movements, and clans and communities. I want to do my best to contribute to the future of my Motherland and give hope to countrymen that one day our Kyrgyzstan will be one of the most stable and most developed countries in the world.

I am social, active and well-rounded person. I have a good relationship with my classmates, teachers and friends at school which gives me hope for a bright future. At the Sociology Department, I hope to develop my interpersonal skills. AUCA provides  a solid foundation in sociological research and theory and prepares students to work in a variety of academic and professional careers. I am sure that I made the right choice.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 32 años, es casada, su esposo tiene 45 años, son padres de tres hijos, se dedica  la venta de pan (reventa), también a vender otra clase de productos de forma ambulante y en su casa, lo hace junto  a su esposo de lunes  a sábado, ya cuenta con dos años de experiencia.
Con el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pan, bebidas y golosinas, lo que da la oportunidad de fortalecer el negocio y tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Le ayudara a tener nuevos clientes, mejorar las ventas y con ello tendrá mejores ingresos con los cueles cancelara las cuotas de su crédito.
Sus aspiraciones son  tener más ingresos, ofrecer productos de calidad a buen precio y mejorar poco a poco las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old. She is married. Her husband is 45, and they are parents of three children. She sells bread (which she buys). She also sells other types of products as a street vendor and in her house. She does this together with her husband, from Monday to Saturday. She already has two years of experience.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of bread, beverages, and candies, which will give her the opportunity to strengthen her business and have more products to offer her customers. It will help her to have new customers and improve her sales, and with that she will have better income, with which she will make the payments on her loans.

Her goals are to have more income, offer quality products at a good price, and little by little improve the family conditions.

loans.use: to buy bread, beverages, and candies to sell

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
Bismark Antonio es un joven de 36 años, originario del municipio de El Jicaral del departamento de León, padre de un niño en edad escolar.
Se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad en un colegio de secundaria de la localidad donde tiene varios años de servicio.
Gracias a este trabajo le ha permitido mejorar su casita donde hoy le brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y sobre todo llevar el pan de cada día y darle educación a su hijo.
Bismark se dio cuenta que hay una organización llamado Kiva que prestan dinero a las personas de escasos recursos a través de Ceprodel por lo que se presentó por primera vez a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito para la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes y zapatos, ya que su hijo iniciará el año escolar y en este momento no cuenta con fondo disponible para cubrir estos gastos.
Espera y confía en Dios que le apoyen con su solicitud.
texts.en:
Bismark Antonio is a 36 year old young man from El Jicaral, within the Leon department and is the father of a school aged boy.

He works as a security guard at a local middle school and has several years of service.

Thanks to this work he has been able to make improvements to his little house and now provides his family with better living conditions and above all brings home the bacon and provides an education for his son.

Bismark learned of an organization called Kiva that lends money to people of scarce resources through CEPRODEL and asked for his first loan to buy school supplies, uniforms, and shoes since his son is starting the school year.  He doesn’t have the funds to cover those expenses.

He hopes and confides in the Lord that he will get the help he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Maylanie

texts.en:
Maylanie is from the village of San Marcelo, in the town of Angadanan.  She is 22 years old and is married with one child.  Maylanie earns a living in the retail business.  She has run this kind of business for ten months.  She usually earns about 300 PHP a day. Maylanie asks for  a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and snack foods to sell.

She hopes to grow her business and achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and snack foods to sel.l

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старший сын работает в столице Кыргызстана, помогает родителям материально, остальные дети проживают с родителями, помогают по хозяйству. У Гулжамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулжамал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 28 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулжамал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Guljamal is 54 years old and married. She and her husband have raised three children. The eldest son works in Kyrgzystan's capital and helps his parents financially. The other children live with them and help on the farm. Guljamal has received secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Guljamal raises livestock and grows produce, having started 22 years ago by buying livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Guljamal's hard work, her farm now includes four dairy cows, two horses, and 28 sheep. Her monthly income is 11,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Guljamal has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to increase her livestock headcount by buying sheep. Guljamal plans to use the income from her low for a further increase of livestock, and plans to save up for house renovations.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Yessica Mireya

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Yessica, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de  hijos de 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 8 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela, ella vive en casa de su abuela.
Doña Yessica es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale todos los días por las mañanas ya que aprovecha que sus hijos están estudiando porque den la tarde tiene que ayudarles en las tareas en las tareas de la escuela, ella quiere  que sus hijos sean muy cumplidos y buenos estudiantes para que se forjen un mejor futuro, por esa razón lucha día a día y desde hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio para darles lo mejor.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas.  Lleva 7 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas lending group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the Coffee Sultan because of its extensive coffee crops with a unique flavor, for its food, and for the warmth of its people.

Yessica lives here.  She is 34 years old and the single mother of three children, ages 13, 9, and 8.  The oldest attends high school and the younger ones attend school.  She lives with her grandmother.

Yessica is a hardworking woman who has had to work very hard to get her children ahead.  She is a merchant and sells clothing of all types door to door.  She goes out every morning so she can use the time during which her children are in school because she needs to help them with their homework in the evenings.  She wants her children to be good students so they can forge a better future.  For this reason she works day to day and has been doing so for six years.  She has this business so she can provide them with the best.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirt, and other articles.  She has been with the lending group for seven years and likes is because she started her business with one of the loans.  Her dreams are to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elvia María

texts.es:
EL Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café, por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Elvia, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de  25, 24, 20, 18 y 10 años  de edad, solo  la menor vive con ella y estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Elvia es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice para su negocio el cual es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para salir adelante, el se dedica a la venta artículos para el hogar, vende vajillas, ollas, cucharas, cuchillos, licuadoras y varios utensilios de cocina, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual recorre la ciudad en su carro, también dos o tres veces por semana se desplaza a varios sitios cercanos de la ciudad donde tiene muy buenos clientes, el lleva más de 12 años con esta actividad la misma que le permite sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ollas, platos, cucharas y licuadoras. Lleva más de 8 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten  ayudar a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un local en la ciudad.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas lending group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa settlement, known as the Coffee Sultan because of its extensive coffee crops with a unique flavor, for its food, and for the warmth of its people.

Elvia lives here.  She is 46 years old, married, and has five children, ages 25, 24, 20, 18, and 10, but only the youngest one lives with her and attends school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Elvia is a good wife who is asking for this loan so that her husband can use it for his business, which is their only source of income.  He sells household items such as dinnerware, pots, spoons, knives, blenders and various kitchen items door to door and travels the city by car.  Two or three times a week he travels to nearby areas in the city where he has very good customers.  He has been doing this for more than 12 years and allows him to get his family ahead.

This loan is to buy pots, plates, spoons, and blenders.  She has been with the lending group for more than eight years and likes it because she can help her husband.  Her dreams are to have a shop in town.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Orng

texts.en:
Orng is a 59-year-old married woman and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Orng and her husband (shown with her in the picture) have grown rice and raised animals for more than ten years and earn approximately $6 a day. One of her children is employed and earns about $5 a day. To improve her family’s finances, Orng requests a loan of $1,500 to purchase clothes to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a clothes store at the market and help her youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a first-year student of AUCA's department of Business Administration. Here is her story.

“I have a dream to study Business Administration. There are many good professions but this is appropriate for me. There are not many business women in Kyrgyzstan. It seems to be a stereotype that good business leaders are men. But we live in the 21st century when gender should not matter. It’s also well known that our government doesn’t pay attention to small businesses and beginners have to rely only on themselves.  I have a great interest in economics, finance and have a lot of ideas for the future. One idea is to open an English children's garden in Bishkek. As we know, everyone should know English in order to be well-educated and prosperous in the future, so my plan should work.  If I wish to start my own business in the future, I need to know every detail about it. That is the reason why I want to study Business Administration at AUCA.

AUCA is not a new university to me. It’s common to hear about it from my friends and relatives  that it provides a  high level of knowledge in many spheres of activities. It is considered to be the most prestigious and highly-qualified University of Central Asia. I believe that AUCA will help me in my future  and I will have a chance to become a successful Kyrgyzstan business woman.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education tuition costs.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics program, this is her story.

“Once I had an interesting dream. I was 28, had a business-like hairstyle, wore a luxury classic suit, and had glittering eyes with a satisfied look. I was busy talking on the  phone, speaking in English with foreign colleagues; I was an ambassador.  I want my dream to come true. That is why I have chosen the department of International and Comparative Politics.

One of the people who had an impact on my decision to choose this profession is my aunt. She had been an ambassador in India. Once, she came as a guest to my home and began talking about what she did, what countries she visited and how the knowledge of English helped her to achieve her goals. She explained to me the need for worthy politicians in Kyrgyzstan, and explained  their duties and the responsibilities of this career.  I liked her idea and wanted to be like my aunt.

I was one of the best students at school, loved English, and took part in English Olympiads contests. Besides this, I was a member of the school parliament, head of a social committee, and volunteered in two NGOs and visited different towns and villages.  I helped to train people about HIV and AIDs, leadership, tolerance, and human rights. Now I study at AUCA which is one of the leading Universities in Central Asia.  I study with the best and outstanding students from different countries. I believe I can achieve my goals with AUCA as it provides a full spectrum of opportunities for higher education that meet international educational standards.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Manwela

texts.en: Hardship and difficulties in life push Manwela to strive harder in attaining her goals. She aims to improve her small variety store to increase her income. She is 40 years old and chose to be single. She plans to earn and save more income to invest in another business and support her younger brother and sisters. To make her goals realistic, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soap and seasonings to sell. Manwela hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted for the further growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soap and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a 34-year-old mother who sells a variety of groceries within her village. She has been in operation for 13 years. Now she plans to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, cooking oil and fish paste.

Loida is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She knows that this amount will be of great help in improving her general store and satisfying her customers' demands. She hopes to increase her profits through her requested loan so she can cover all their household expenses and the educational maintenance of her two children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, cooking oil and fish paste for her general store

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчону 29 лет. Он начинает новый бизнес в сфере торговли. Недавно он стал отцом и очень счастлив. Илхомчон живет с женой и своим малышом в городе Вахдат. Он очень любит свою семью и хочет хорошо обеспечивать их. Илхомчон в центральном рынке купил помещение для магазина. Он собирается торговать там детскими одеждами. У него на руках осталось немного сбережения, ему еще не хватает 2100 долларов США, чтобы привезти товар. Эту сумму он запрашивает в кредит. Илхомчон имеет опыт в сфере продаж. За счет кредита и суммы сбережения Илхомчон хочет закупить ассортимент сезонной детской одежды и открыть свой магазин. Он полагается на вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is 29 years old.  He is starting a new business in a retail field.  Recently, he became a father and is very happy.  Ilhomjon lives with his wife and his baby in the city of Vahdat.  He loves his family very much and wants to provide well for them.  Ilhomjon bought a space for a store at the central market.  He is planning to sell children's clothing there.  He has some savings remaining, but he is short 2100 US dollars to bring in merchandise.  He is requesting this amount as a loan.  Ilhomjon has experience in the retail sales field.  Ilhomjon wants to use the loan amount and savings to buy a selection of seasonal children's clothing and open his store.  He is relying on your financial support.

loans.use: to buy a selection of seasonal children's clothing and start his retail business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en:
Chanthan is a married woman with two children. She is 47 years old and she is a seller. Her husband is a palm climber. Both of them can earn $40 per day. One of her children is a laborer who can make $4 per day. 

Since she has to pay large expenses on transport, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband, so he can transport for her small business every day. In the future, Chanthan hopes to not only enhance her business but also renovate her house by building a bathroom and toilet.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use as transport for her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 41 años es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella trabaja en su bodega que implemento hace varios años. Y a la vez vende alfalfa y cuyes. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo con los gasto de la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar y aceite. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jaqueline es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 41 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 2 dependents. She works in the store she opened several years ago. She also sells alfalfa and guinea pigs. In this way, she is able to help her husband with the education and food expenses for their children. She will invest the loan in buying rice, sugar and oil. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors or the support they have given. Jaqueline is the second one from the left.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Sros, 34, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Sros earns a living as a rice farmer. To supplement the income, her husband works as a garment worker. Together, they can earn about 34,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sros has been with VisionFund for two cycles and paid back her previous loans. Sros used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es:
Ella es  julieth es una mujer con  aspiraciones, responsable con grandes capacidades y desempeño dentro de las  labores y estudios. 

Dentro de las capacidades que tiene destaca el cumplimiento de las labores asignadas de una manera igual de  eficiente y efectiva, con conocimiento puntualidad y un desarrollo metódico y ordenado, honestidad, aprendo con facilidad y le gusta superarse. 

Ella es sencilla, alegre, cariñosa, impulsiva le gusta el área  de enfermería  porque es una carrera humanista con principios y valores, de muchos grandes conocimientos,  ya que le enseña a valorar y a darle atención y ayuda a  aquellos que lo necesita, es una profesión dedicada   al cuidado de la salud del ser humano. 

Para ella sería muy útil este convenio con kiva ya que le ofrecen un subsidio con el cual ella no contaba y eso le ayuda a poder tener la economía más estable en el hogar y con ella misma.
texts.en:
This is Julieth, a responsible and talented woman with great aspirations. She performs well at work and in her studies.

Among her talents, the efficiency with which she performs her tasks can be highlighted. She knows what she is doing and delivers on time, and she works methodically and in an organized manner. She learns quickly and likes to better herself.

Julieth is a simple, joyful, affectionate and impulsive woman. She likes Nursing because she thinks it is a humane profession with good principles and values. She has access to a lot of knowledge and has learned to help and care about those in need; it is a profession devoted to taking care of human health.

She finds the agreement with Kiva very useful, because she has access to a loan that was not available before, and will help her to reach a more stable economy, both personally and at home.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's fees.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
Lay is 49 years old and living with her husband and four children in a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district. Rubber planting has been the only main source for her family’s income for about almost 30 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 100,000 KHR, but she is able to save 50,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Lay with VisionFund and she completely paid back the first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees. She hopes to grow her rubber in a timely fashion so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Bhagaban

texts.en:
Bhagaban, a 41-year-old differently able man, lives with his brother, brother's wife and their children in a small village in Odisha, India. He is unmarried. He owns a very small general store. For the last ten years, he has been running this business to support his brother's family as he doesn't have family and also he does not want to be a burden to his brother.

Bhagaban has requested a loan to purchase daily households items, like sugar, tea, biscuits, soap, spices, etc., for his general store. He is very thankful to Kiva's lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To purchase daily households items, like sugar, tea, biscuits, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir is a 39-year-old pensioner. He is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and brings up the children while the head of family works. He sells fruits (pineapples, bananas, oranges, etc.) at the local bazaar and works in this field for 19 years. His monthly income from selling fruits is AZN 150.

People know that fruits are very useful for health and buy them often. They like to eat them fresh or make different kinds of juice. Local restaurants know that Zahir’s fruits are always fresh and delicious. That’s why they are his constant clients. 

Unfortunately, Zahir’s fruit assortment isn’t diverse enough. He has applied for an AZN 2,000 loan in order to deliver more fruits for his greengrocery. This is his third loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to deliver more fruits for his greengrocery.

loans.name: Bhagatram

texts.en:
Bhagatram is a 27-year-old differently able man. He lives with his wife, one child and his elder brother. Bhagatram runs his terracotta business with the help of his brother. He learned this work in his childhood as it is their family occupation. He makes earthen pots and statues of gods and paints them. His brother helps him to supply finished products to dealers in the market.

Bhagatram plans to expand his business and appoint new work staff to help him. He plans to own a shop in the marketplace for direct sale of the product to end customers. He needs a loan of 20,000 Indian rupees to buy more resources, like paints, brushes, and ornaments for statues (statues of Indian gods and goddesses), and to set up his own shop in the market. He wants to give his child a better education and let his family live a happy life.

loans.use: To pay for more clay and paints for his terracotta work and to set up his own shop in the market

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Because Sita is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Sita was born in 1969. She is married and a mother of seven living in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a taxi driver. 

One of her daughters is studying for her bachelor's degree, majoring in law. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation. Sita noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing which is not helping him in paying his daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Sita has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
This is Rosy, 44, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Rogel, an employee. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosy operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Rosy dreams to have another food stall and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is an industrious person. She is 36 years old, married and blessed with five children in the village.

She engages in a piggery business. She has been running her business for three years. Now she is in need of additional capital amounting to PHP 7,000. This would allow her to buy feeds and vitamins for her hogs. She believes that supplying her hogs with proper nutrition and vitamins will enable her to obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Sovannak's Group

texts.en:
Sovannak, age 42, is living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district and has three children. 

She and her husband have been growing taro for 15 years and her husband is also a house construction worker. They can earn about 17,000 KHR per day to support the family. 

Sovannak has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully repaid the loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She will use her portion to buy taro seeds and fertilizers. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy taro seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en: Maram was born in 1990. She is a divorced woman living alone in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Maram has been selling different products such as clothes, blankets, women shoes, perfumes and accessories since two years ago. She started her project with a small quantity of products. Maram noticed that she is receiving more accessories requests from her customers.
