So, she wants to buy a larger quantity of accessories and to add variety to them in order to respond to her customers’ requests and to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more accessories for her business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal was born in 1971. She is married and a mother of four living in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Salt. Her husband sells shisha flavors (tobacco). 

For three years, Manal has been trying her best to support her family and to help her husband in covering their children's needs by running her project of selling clothes and shoes. She needs to expand now by buying more clothes and shoes to attract more customers and to increase her profit. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 46 years old, from Kinungi in Naivasha, and is married. Together they have five children aged between 21 and three-years-old.

Henry has a quarry business that he has been running for the past five years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy some drilling machines and boost his business.

He hopes to see his business expand and to do better in the near future.

loans.use: to buy some drilling machines.

loans.name: Ranjan

texts.en:
Ranjan is 30 years old and a differently able man who lives with his parents and younger brother in a small village of Odisha, India. He owns a grocery shop and he sells grocery items like rice, flour, edible oil, sugar, biscuits, washing powder, etc. He has been running this business for eight years to support his family. He wants to give a better standard of life to his family and also wants to save some money for his future. He also hopes to construct a house for his family.

He has a good customer base in his village and he wants to fill his shop with more grocery items so he can increase his customer base as well as his monthly income. For this he has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase grocery items like rice, flour, edible oil, sugar, biscuits, washing powder, etc. in bulk.

He is very grateful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items like rice, flour, edible oil, sugar, biscuits, washing powder, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 25 years old, married to Ezekiel, and they are blessed with two children. 

She runs a mobile money transfer and saloon businesses in Kamelil and is served by VisionFund Kenya Kapsabet Branch. She has been in this business for the last two years, and from this business she gets an average monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 that she will use as money float for mobile money transfers to increase her source of income in terms of commissions. With the anticipated profits she will pay her children's school fees and repay the loan as well as improve her dairy cows for better production.

Her dream is to give the best education to her children as well as expand her business so that she will be able to meet her financial obligations without difficulty.

loans.use: to add enough float for the M-PESA money transfer.

loans.name: Hanah

texts.en:
Hanah is 49 years old and a single mother of five children between the ages of 22 and seven years old.

She owns a quarry that she has been operating for 20 years. Hanah has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to pay for labor, thus increasing her sales, which will lead to an increased income. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay the school fees for her children.

In the near future, she hopes to develop her quarry business to enable her to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to pay for labor in her quarry.

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Lot, 37, has three children. Lot and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for five years to make a living. The current business earns her about 24,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Lot is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1992. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his parents and six sisters. 

Mohammad has been running his mini market for three years. He started his project selling a small amount of food products. Then he started expanding it gradually. His future plan is to open a restaurant near his mini market which will raise his profit. 

Now he seeks a youth loan to merchandise his mini market with new products to attract more customers and to raise his income.

loans.use: to merchandise his mini market with new products.

loans.name: Margarita Isabel

texts.es: Margarita tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene sus gastos gracias a su pequeño negocio de comedor, alquila un local cerca de su casa de habitación, junto con su esposo lucha a diario para sacar a delante a sus dos pequeños hijos. Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en mejora de infraestructura de su hogar, necesita comprar materiales de construcción, para continuar con una segunda etapa de realización de un muro perimetral.
texts.en:
Margarita is 30 years old. She maintains her expenses thanks to her small cafeteria business. She rents a space near the house where she lives and together with her husband, she fights every day to improve things for her small children.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the improvement of her house's infrastructure. She needs to buy construction materials to continue with a second step in the building of a perimeter wall.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, quarried stone, cement

loans.name: Peter Warimwe

texts.en: Peter is 35 years old and married to Naomi. Together they are blessed with four children between the ages of twelve and three and one-half years old. He owns a quarry, which he has been operating for six years, and has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to pay for labor hence increasing sales, which will lead to increased income. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees and also expand his business. In the near future, he hopes to develop his quarry business into a big industry.

loans.use: To pay for labor.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
This is Salome, 47, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Salome operates a variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Salome hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a happy family. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group has 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar was born in 1994. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his parents and four brothers. 

He has been running his mini market for one year. He started his project selling a small amount of food products. Then he started expanding it gradually. 

Now Omar is seeking a youth loan to merchandise his mini market with new products to attract more customers and to raise his income.

loans.use: to merchandise his mini market with new products.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1979. She is a divorced woman living alone in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. 

She decided to start running her own snacks store where she has been selling food products for five years to cover her needs. Then she expanded it to be a mini market. 

Now her mini market is out of food products. She needs to merchandise it and to add variety to her products to expand her project and earn better profit in order to improve her living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase some basic food products.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 20-year-old young lady who lives in a sector of Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and five siblings. Her father is retired and her mother works at a university. 

Eman is studying for a Bachelors’ degree in Special Education. She is in her third year and is planning to work in her field after graduation to help her family, as they are facing a financial crisis. Since they cannot help her pay her school fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is 30 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Enid has been working hard to manage a stationery shop, which sells writing and office supply items. 

To help expand the business, Enid has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stationery items, and will help Enid to generate greater profits and increase capital. Enid hopes that in the future she will be able to have more customers.

loans.use: buy more stationery items

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom is aged 29 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 37,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sarom has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her previous loan, which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sarom is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn additional income. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita's primary source of income comes from her hog-raising business. She is thankful because she has been able to keep her business up to this moment. She has operated this kind of business for three years, so she has learned strategies to improve her business.

For continuous smooth flow of her hog raising business, she decided to seek additional capital of PHP 7,000, allowing her to buy stock feed, medicine and vitamins. She knows that it would be of great help in supplying her hogs with good nutrition. She hopes to get her requested loan to gain enough profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock feed, medicine and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Sundar

texts.en:
Sundar is 27 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his parents, wife and one child in a small village of Odisha, India. He has been engaged in goat rearing for the last eight years. He purchases the goat kids and then raises them and sells them when they become grown. He also sells goat milk. Currently he has 20 goats. He is earning 3,000 INR per month. He wants to increase his income so he plans to purchase more goat kids so he can earn more.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase goat kids and renovate the goat shed. He wants to give his family a better standard of living and hopes to build a house. He is thankful to KIVA for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase goat kids and renovate the goat shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy curd, cheese, soft cheese, and cream

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Saroem is 59 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals. They make $6 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Saroem is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to breed and use for her farming. This purchase will improve her farming business. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and use for her farming

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her business, which sells charcoal. 

Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, which will help Mary to generate greater profits and expand the business. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business.

loans.use: buy more charcoal

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 42 years old, married to Agnes, and together they are blessed with two children, 12 and 1 year old.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for four years. He has applied for a fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy stock such sugar, rice and flour, among other item,s for his business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees and also expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy stock such as sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah used her first loan to invest in the business which has been doing well. She has borrowed a loan of KES. 45,000 which she will use to pay school fees for her children.
 
With the anticipated profits she will  pay her children's school fees and make the loan repayment as well as expand her grocery  and farming businesses.

Her dream is to give the best education to her children as well as expand her business to a point where she will be able to meet all her financial obligations.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery products to use for his business.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en: Wesal was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of five, living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Karak. Her husband is retired. Wesal has been trying her best to support her family and to help her husband in covering their children's needs by running her project selling home products for 13 years. She needs to expand it more now by buying a larger quantity of home products and adding variety and improving her store, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Al-Amira Group

texts.en: Al-Amira group consists of four women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 160,000 YER to pay for the purchase of clothes, perfumes, incense and henna. Amal is a 34-year-old married woman with no children. She is the leader of the group. She lives with her family. She has been selling perfumes, incense and henna to assist her husband to pay for essential living expenses. This business has been profitable. She wants to expand her business  so she applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER to buy perfumes, incense and henna. She looks forward to opening a store selling clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and henna to expand her business.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sonia es una humilde mujer que hace tortillas, vende productos básicos en su pequeña pulpería que ha formado con muchos esfuerzos, tiene a dos de sus hijos bajo su cargo, quienes se están preparando estudiando para un futuro mejor. Doña Sonia solicita el crédito para invertir en maíz, queso, crema y cerdo en pie para comercializarlo, así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Sonia is a humble woman who makes tortillas and sells basic products in her small grocery that she created with a lot of effort. She has two of her children in her charge, who are studying, preparing themselves for a better future. Sonia requests the loan to invest in corn, cheese, cream, and live pigs for commercializing, and so improving her income.

loans.use: to invest in corn, cheese, cream and live pigs for commercialization

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is 19 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family, consisting of four siblings and his parents. He is studying for his Bachelor's, majoring in Political Science. He is in his second year. Husam is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ream's Group

texts.en:
Ream, 51, lives with her four children in a village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice for almost ten years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Ream is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  Ream is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor fees for harvesting rice. She hopes to get a bigger harvest from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees for harvesting rice

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Sara, mujer trabajadora que busca el porvenir de sus hijos quienes están estudiando, ella cuenta con una actividad comercial que es la venta de ropa y calzado de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, para la cual solicita este apoyo de crédito para invertir con variedad de blusas, pantalones, para cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, de esta manera compartir los gastos del hogar con su esposo quien trabaja como conductor.
texts.en: Sara, a hardworking woman, wishes to provide for the future of her children, who are students. Her business is selling clothing and footwear as an itinerant vendor and in her house. For this she is requesting a loan to invest in a variety of blouses and pants, in order to fill her customers' orders. In this way she will share household expenses with her husband, who works as a driver.

loans.use: To buy a variety of blouses, pants and footwear.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Don José es un humilde soldador, tiene un hijo en la actualidad a quien apoya  económicamente, con su crédito anterior logro invertir en la mejora de  la infraestructura de su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio, ahora tiene la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, ya que el techo está muy deteriorado y con el financiamiento podrá comprar los materiales para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
José is a humble welder.  He has one child whom he currently supports financially.  With his previous loan he managed to improve the infrastructure of his business in order to provide better service.

He now needs to improve the condition of his home.  The roof has deteriorated.  With the loan he will be able to buy materials to start the work.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal was born in 1961. She is a divorced woman living alone in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Salt. She has been selling bed sheets for two years to be able to cover her needs. Now she needs to buy more bed sheets and to add variety to her products in order to expand her project and earn better profit so as to improve her living conditions, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for her business

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 26 years old and married to Moses. They have no children. She has a retail shop and also sells cereals. She has been in this business for three years now, and she makes a monthly income of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She plans to use the loan to buy more goods such as sugar, cooking fat, rice, beans, wheat and maize flour for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business as well as support her education. 

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her first loan successfully. Her future hopes and dreams are to own a vehicle transport business and a wholesale business, and be able to cater for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy retail goods for selling.

loans.name: Lida's Group

texts.en:
Aged 26, Lida is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for seven years.

She is a second cycle client with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loan which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para sacar adelante a su único hijo, ella se dedica a trabajar como docente en un colegio y su esposo como conductor privado. Claudia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y empezar a realizar el muro perimetral de su casa, ya que habitan en una zona rural en donde es peligrosa por los delincuentes.
texts.en:
Claudia and her husband both work hard to bring up their only son. She works as a teacher in a school and her husband is a private driver. 

Claudia is asking for the loan to buy building materials so she can start building the perimeter wall around her house, since they live in a rural area where it is dangerous because of the criminals.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, sand, cement and iron.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana was born in 1976. She is a single lady living in a a sector in Jordan called Karak with her retired older sister. Her parents are deceased. She has been trying her best to help her sister in improving their living conditions and covering their needs by running her business of selling clothes and blankets at her house for 5 years. She needs to expand the business more now by buying a larger quantity of clothes and adding variety to them in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes and add variety to them.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 31 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children, aged 11 and 6 years old. She has a beauty salon and has been in the business for three years. Right now, her monthly income from her business is 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). Her spouse also provides additional income.

She will be using the loan to purchase a dryer and beauty products for use in her salon. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to add stock of beauty products and salon equipment and repay her loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her hopes for the future are to have a chain of beauty salons and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy a dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en: Wesal is a 22-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her parents and 7 brothers. She is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Special Education. She is in her 4th year and is only one step away from graduation. Wesal is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start her work life in order to help her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is 22 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of 4 brothers and his mother. His father is deceased. He is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Business Administration. He is in his 3rd year. Abdullah is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis after his father's death which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Alnaji

texts.en: Alnaji is 21 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his family consisting of 4 siblings and his mother. His father is deceased. He is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Class Teaching. He is in his 4th year and is only one step away from graduation. Alnaji is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis after his father's death which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of 7 living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. One of her daughters is studying for her Bachelor's degree, majoring in Information Systems Management. She is in her 2nd year and is planning to work in her study field after graduation. 

Mona noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing which is not helping him in paying his daughter's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Mona has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her daughters' upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the sheep for the winter season.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is in her fifties, married, and has two grown children. She started vending vegetables with the capital of PHP 3,000. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Rosy patiently manages her vending business just to earn income for her children's daily allowances. Now she sells a variety of vegetables, meat and fish. 

Sometimes, she is not able to fill her customers' demands due to insufficient capital. Thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy vegetables, meat and fish. Rosy hopes to manage her business well, further developing her business toward success.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and fish to be sold.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: El señor Filemón tiene 40 años de edad, nació en la provincia campero, es soltero y tiene 1 hija independiente, actualmente vive en casa de su hija en la población de Ivirgarzama, tuvo una instrucción hasta el nivel primario debido a los escasos recursos de sus padres que no le ayudaron a seguir estudiando,  por lo mismo empezó a trabajar desde muy joven y uno de sus tíos lo trajo al trópico de Cochabamba para que le ayude en las cosechas,  después de un tiempo conoció a la madre de su hija que al final lo abandono,  desde entonces el solo se hizo responsable de ella. Después de mucho trabajo, con sus ahorros se compró su lote agrícola, donde cultiva  yuca y arroz, ahora solicita un crédito para la construcción de una pequeña vivienda en su lote,  porque ya no quiere molestar a su hija, y desea tener su propia casa  y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Filemón is 40 years old and was born in Campero province. He is single and has a daughter who is independent. He currently lives in his daughter's house in the town of Ivirgarzama. Filemón only has primary education because of the limited income of his parents, who did not help him to continue with his education. For the same reason he started work very young and one of his uncles took him to the tropical area of Cochabamba to help him with the harvests. 

After a while he met the mother of his daughter who in the end left him, and since them he has taken on full responsibility for her on his own. After a great deal of work, he used his savings to buy a piece of agricultural land where he grows cassava and rice.

Filemón is now asking for a loan to build a small house on his land, because he does not want to be a nuisance to his daughter any more and he wants to have his own house and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to build a small house on his plot of land.

loans.name: Mirta Juana

texts.es: La señora Mirta es viuda su esposo falleció hace algunos años, desde entonces trabaja sola para sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a la agricultura contratando jornaleros para la producción, en la anterior cosecha tuvo problemas climáticos y también sufrió la escases de agua de riego, por efecto sus sembradíos bajaron su rendimiento haciendo que la producción sea mínima, en consecuencia sus ingresos económicos se vieron sumamente afectados porque estos dependen de la producción agrícola. Cada año produce principalmente papa, cebolla, y frejol.  La señora es una persona muy trabajadora, actualmente vive  con  uno de sus hijos quien le colabora en el trabajo. Como no tiene muchos recursos, solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para mejorar su producción y ampliar su frontera agrícola con el fin de tener mayores ingresos económicos y proporcionar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mirta is a widow; her husband passed away some years ago. Since then, she works alone to get her family ahead. She works in agriculture, contracting day laborers for production. During the last harvest, she had climate problems and also suffered from shortages of irritation water. Therefore, her crops lowered their yield making a minimum production. In consequence, her economic income was summarily affected because it depends on her agricultural production. Each year, she mainly produces potatoes, onions and beans.

The woman is a very hardworking person. She currently lives with one of her children who helps her with the work. Since she doesn't have many resources, she is applying for a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies to improve her production and expand her agricultural frontier, with the goal of having better economic income and providing better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to improve her production and expand her agricultural frontier.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khorn is 47 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in rice farming for years. The current business earns her family about 33,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Khorn has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient food and education for her children. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current rice crops to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 22-year-old single woman from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family's needs. Siham is a student in the university where she studies English literature. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a job to help her family with their expenses. 

She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Siham will be able to do her homework and read articles online. She appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is 56-years-old and has seven adult children. 

Prima works hard raising hogs to earn an income for her family. This is her source of livelihood while trying to help her husband who works as a company guard. She is asking for a loan to support her business. She will buy feed to fatten her hogs and another piglet to raise. Prima started this business a year ago but hopes to see it grow and hopefully expand someday to make this more profitable.

Her income provides food and helps pay for the household bills.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Sach's Group

texts.en:
Sach, 30, is from a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice. The current business earns her about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sach has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Sach is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to harvest rice. She hopes to have a bigger harvest and earn more money.

loans.use: to harvest rice

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, comes from Nyandarua South, and is married to Margaret. They have seven children who are aged between 16 years and nine months old.

He is a farmer and has been in this line of work for many years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1980. He is married and has 2 sons. He is living in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour. Mohammad has been running his store for 5 years, selling vehicle spare parts and car repairing tools. He is trying his best to cover his family's needs, and his store is his only source of income. 

He needs to expand it in order to earn a better income and more profit. Now he needs to buy a larger quantity of vehicle spare parts to raise his income, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Alberto Luiz

texts.es: EL señor Alberto es una persona responsable y trabajadora, curso hasta la primaria ya que no pudo concluir el bachillerato porque sus padres tenían problemas económicos, por lo mismo tuvo la necesidad de buscar trabajo desde muy joven. De estado civil soltero no tiene hijos, ni familiares que dependan de sus ingresos. Vive en condición de inquilino, ya que no cuenta con una vivienda propia. Hoy en día el desempeña la labor de transportista de pasajeros, trabaja con su vehículo como taxista, como su auto tiene problemas solicita un crédito para reparar su vehículo y ofrecer un mejor servicio, esto le sera de gran beneficio para seguir con su actividad y continuar percibiendo ingresos para cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar las condiciones en las que vive.
texts.en:
Alberto is a responsible and hard-working person. He finished primary school but could not attend secondary school because his parents had economic problems. For the same reason, he had to work from a very young age.

Alberto is single and has no children, nor any family members who depend upon his income. He lives as a tenant, lacking a house of his own. 

At present Alberto works transporting passengers, using his own vehicle as a taxi. Since his auto has problems, he is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle and offer better service. This will be of great benefit, enabling Alberto to continue this activity, bringing in the income needed to cover all his costs and improve the conditions in which he lives.

loans.use: repair his vehicle, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
During Eva's young age, she experienced hardship and difficulties in life. Now, she hopes and prays that her children will not experience her same experiences in life. She and her husband are doing their best just to give a better way of living to their children. 

Eva is now 48 years old and engaged in a retailing business. Her husband's work is on a farming business.

Eva’s priority in life is to send her children to school and let them finish their studies. To make all her goals possible, she is requesting additional capital of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy grocery items such as biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, soap and toothpaste to sell. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan so she could keep her business well and be able to obtain greater profits someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, conditioner, soap and toothpaste to sell

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 24 years old and is single. He supports his four siblings in his family. He operates a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for three years now. He makes a monthly income of about KES 15,000. 

He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts so as to repair and service his motorcycle. This will enable him to keep his motorcycle in good condition and thereby offer better services, which will enable him to make more income and buy another motorcycle. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hope is to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 55 years old and married. He does dairy farming in Kangundo town. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with seven children. His spouse also provides additional income. Sammy has been in the dairy farming business for 11 years now and the business has been profitable.

He will use this loan to buy two dairy cows. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to purchase a water tank and also to repay the loan. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future he hopes to expand his business, open a grocery store for his wife and live a stable life together with his family.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops and keeps livestock. She is 27 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children aged eight and five years old. Her spouse also provides additional income. She has been in the farming business for 10 years and right now her monthly income from her business is 25,000 KES.

She will be using this loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds for planting. This will enable her to get more farm produce. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her farming.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hope is to be a successful farmer and educate her children well.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en: Marwa is a 20-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Rasifeh with her parents and three brothers. She is studying for a Bachelors degree, majoring in finance. She is in her third year. Marwa is planning to work in her study field after graduation to start her work life in order to help her family financially, as they are currently facing financial crisis, which is not helping them pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is 48-years-old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with seven children. She is a farmer in Kangundo town where she plants cash crops such as maize and beans to sell. Her husband also provides additional income. She also supports four people in her family. 

She will be using the loan to pay school fees for her daughter who is in secondary school. This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully.

Her future hope is to become a large scale farmer and see all her children get a good education.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha is 48-years-old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has six children. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 15 years. To supplement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee. 

This is the sixth micro loan for Tha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Tha will use her portion to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes to increase more crops to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds for planting

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon  est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koulikoro de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants chacune.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, des habits cousus, pagnes, tissus, bazin, de la couture etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Sanata, 1 ère de la gauche vers la droite, est une couturière et vendeuse de vêtements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes, bazin et tissus afin de les coudre en vêtements de plusieurs modèles. Elle se procure de ces articles  à Koutiala et effectue ses ventes au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Yeredon comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sanata compte réaliser  168 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles ambitionnent renforcer leur partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Yaredon is a group of women from the Koulikoro neighborhood of Koutiala who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents. The women have an average age of 37 years, are married, and have at least 3 children each. 

This group of women is in the business of various items, such as sewn clothing, "pagne" cloth, cloth, brocade, dressmaking, etc. In order to expand their businesses, the members decided to partner with the loan program from Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their tenth group loan.

Sanata, the first pictured standing from left to right, is a seamstress and a seller of clothing. She hopes to use her loan to purchase pieces of "pagne" cloth, brocade, and fabric in order to sew them into various styles of clothing. She procures these items in Koutiala and makes her sales for cash from her home and at the market to a varied and diverse customer base.

While the other members of the Yeredon group plan on earning an average profit of 150,000 francs CFA each during this loan cycle, Sanata plans to earn 168,000 francs CFA. In addition to repaying the loan, the women will use a portion of their profits to take care of their personal expenses and to increase their business capital. They hope to expand their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock of merchandise remains plentiful.

loans.use: to purchase "pagne" cloth, fabric, and brocade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 29 years old and a single mother of four children. She grows cash crops to sell in Kangundo town. These includes maize, beans, and vegetables. Besides farming, she also sells scrap metal. She has been in these businesses for four years and right now her monthly income is 40,000 KES.

She will be using the loan to pay school fees for her child who is in secondary school. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

Her hope for the future is to educate her children up to tertiary level and build a modern house.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Erkes

texts.en:
Erkes is a 38-year-old man and is married to Ferly, a 37-year-old-woman. They are blessed with 2 children, namely: Elma, 11, in grade 1 of junior high; and Enzo, one year old. 

Erkes has already been running the kiosk business for 3 years. He initiated the business by using his own capital to build the kiosk building as well as to buy the items to sell such as snacks, beverages, instant ingredients for cooking, mosquito repellent, cell phone credit, instant noodles, etc. The income from the kiosk business is to meet his family's daily needs. 

Erkes plans to restock the items to sell at his kiosk; therefore he requestsed a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 4,500,000. He is hoping the loan provided by TLM will help him improve his business.

loans.use: to buy items for his kiosk such as snacks, instant ingredients for cooking, mosquito repellent, instant noodles, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, now 38 years old, used his previous loan to buy goods to sell in his retail shop. He also runs a motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for two years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He will use this loan to pay school fees for his children. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to buy another motorcycle. 

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has been paying his previous loans successfully. In the future, he hopes to provide good education to his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, now 53 years old, used her previous loan to buy fabrics and sewing machines for use in her tailoring business. The business was profitable and she was able to repay the loan successfully.

This will be her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use the loan to buy more sewing materials for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her tailoring business.

In the future Lucy hopes to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more sewing materials

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Keo is aged 37 years. She and her husband have three children and have earned a living through farming rice for ten years. She can earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Keo is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven emprendedor, dinámico y responsable, a sus 20 años de edad se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y además paga sus estudios universitarios, todo esto con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo que inició como alternativa para generar ingresos; sus principales clientes son compañeros de estudio, vecinos y amigos y trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor y en promociones (lociones, ropa, accesorios, cosméticos, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos disponibles para la venta, así podrá satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, dando paso a un incremento en las ventas y en el margen de utilidades que percibe.
Daniel manifiesta que su principal sueño es lograr tener la capacidad económica para seguir pagando sus estudios y culminar su carrera profesional en Administración y, más adelante, tener la posibilidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young entrepreneur who is dynamic and responsible. At the age of 20 he is taking care of his own personal costs as well as paying for his university studies. He does all of this with the profits he makes from selling merchandise and products from catalogues, which he started doing as an alternative means of making an income. His main customers are his fellow students, neighbours and friends and he works every day without a fixed routine.

In order to strengthen his business, he is asking for the loan to buy merchandise wholesale and on special offer (lotions, clothing, accessories, cosmetics and other items). This will enable him to have a larger variety of products available for sale and so he will be able to satisfy the needs and tastes of his customers. This will lead to an increase in sales and in the profit margin he makes.

Daniel says his main dream is to have the financial resources to continue paying for his studies and finish his degree course in Administration. Later on, he would like to have the possibility of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale to pay for his university studies

loans.name: Alhanna Group

texts.en: This group is called Alhanna, and consists of four women who are all hard-working. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 170,000 YER. Sumia is 32 years old, and she is a married woman and has children. She is a housewife who exerts herself in order to raise her children and to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, she said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself, but it is not enough to cover her household needs. She has requested a loan of 40,000 YER to buy home appliances to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.name: Felleze

texts.en:
In an attempt to expand her livestock activity, Felleze is requesting another loan to add one more dairy cow. 

At the same time, she wants to thank all her lenders for helping her financially to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin de 57  años de edad, casado sin hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos. Y decidió trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
En la actualidad, lucha para salir adelante y gracia a su esfuerzo y tiene por actividad económica  el negocio de compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y por encargo a clientes fijos y eventuales. El dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Marvin agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marvin is 57 years old, he is married and does not have any children under his care.  He is a native of Leon, a place located in the western region of the country.  He is known for being a hardworking, responsible man with a drive for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, he was not able to pursue an education due to lack of financial resources.  Instead, he worked from a young age to help with household expenses.

Currently, he is fighting to get ahead, and thanks to his efforts, he has a business buying and selling hogs.  He performs this work out of his house, and also delivers orders to current and prospective customers.  He works about eight hours a day selling his products.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling food products, so that in the near future he can increase his earnings.  Marvin is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have provided to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they may have a dignified way of earning a living.  .

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock his hog business

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Amalia is a 56-year-old woman who has been engaged in masseuse services. She is from Sikatuna, Bohol. She is married with two grown children. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy alcohol, baby oil, massage oil and towels for her customers. She hopes that with her loan she can keep her business and continue serving her customers for an income. Any revenue is for food and household bills like water and electricity.

loans.use: to buy alcohol, baby oil, massage oil and towels for her customers.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has a barber shop in Kangundo town. He is 36 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. His wife also earns additional income. He has been in the business for three years and right now his monthly income from his business is 14,000 KES. Francis also offers phone charging services to his clients and this has enabled him to increase his income. 

He will be using the loan to buy more phone chargers for charging his clients' phones. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay his loan as well as save more money.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to be a successful businessman and educate his children well.

loans.use: to buy phone chargers for charging clients' phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred, 43 years of age, has a tailoring business in Kangundo town. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with five children. Her spouse also provides additional income for the household. She has been in the business for 13 years and right now her monthly income from her business is 30,000 KES.

She will be using the loan to buy additional material for making clothes. She anticipates making more income which she will use to buy more material as well as repay the loan. 

This is her seventh loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loans successfully. In the future, Winfred hopes to improve the living standards of her family as her business grows.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eveling de 56 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre  le gusta disfruta de la compañia de su hijo. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos se vio obligada a trabajar  desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos en su casa de  habitación y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas  8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: rubor, sombra de ojos, marbelline, delineador, crema hidratantes, perfumes, desmaquilladores, vanidad, lápiz de ojos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos par que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Eveling agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Eveling is 56 years old and married. She has a son who is a minor. She is a native of Leon in the western part of the country. She is hard-working, responsible and wants to get ahead. In her spare time she likes to be with her son. Unfortunately she couldn't study as she had to work from a young age. Today she struggles day to day to provide a better future for her son. 

Thanks to her effort  and her desire to succeed she has been selling cosmetics from her house and by order. She works at her business about 8 hours per day offering products like rouge, eye shadow, mascara, eye liner, moisturizing creams, perfumes, make-up remover, cosmetic cases and eyeglasses. 

The goal of the loan is to invest in the working capital and stock her business so that in the near future she can generate more income. Eveling thanks the lenders at Kiva for the support they offer to people of low economic resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her store with cosmetics.

loans.name: Musyimi

texts.en:
Musyimi is 27 years old and does farming business in Kangundo town. He is married and has no child. He has been in the farming business for five years now and his monthly income from his business is 10,000 KES. He also supports his parents. Besides farming, Musyimi is also a mason. 

He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and farm tools such as watering cans and a trowel. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to repay his loan as well as save more money.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to install electrical power in his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a farmer in Kangundo town where she grows cash crops, such as maize and beans and also keeps livestock. She is 57 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with eight children. One of the children is still in school and all the rest have completed school. 

Tabitha's farming business has been profitable and, right now, her monthly income is KES 20,000. She will be using the loan to pay school fees for her child who is in secondary school. 

This will be Tabitha's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be a large-scale farmer and to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene la edad de 59 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad . El  quiere  comprar cerdas. quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva.  Es el tercer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No Ha realizado otros préstamos en una Cooperativa,o banco pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El   tiene el deseo de tener mejor calidad de vida al aumentar sus ganacias.
texts.en:
Oscar is 59 years old and is married with 3 children who are his main priority. He wants to buy pigs and grow his business and he wants his farm to be very productive. 

This is the third loan he has had from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from a cooperative or bank, but FUDECOSUR provides the loan on better terms and the interest rate is much lower. By increasing his profits he hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Hanife

texts.en:
Hanife was born in 1972 and has two children. Before she opened a cleaning store, she sold for a chain store company from a catalog for extra income. Two years ago she opened a cleaning store with her husband. Now she manages the store. With the loan from Maya she will buy cleaning supplies for the store. More variety means more sales, says Hanife. In fact as supermarkets grow, shopkeepers don't make much, she says. With the loan from Maya, she plans to increase her capital in order to change the store into a clothing shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
1972 doğumlu 2 çocuk annesi olan hanife hanım.  Temizlik dükkanı açmadan önce satış zinciri olan bir firmaya üye olup katolog üzerinden satış yapış kendisine ek gelir sağlıyordu.  2 sene önce eşiyle beraber temizlik dükkanı açtı.  Eşiyle birlikte şu an dükkanını işletiyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile dükkanına temizlik ürünleri aldı. Daha çok çeşit demek daha çok satış olduğunu söylüyor Hanife Hanım.  Fakat marketlerin çoğalmasıyla esnafların fazla kazancı olmadığını söyleyen Hanife Hanım aldığı kredi ile sermayesine fazlalaştırıp ilerleyen zamanlar da dükkanını giyim üzerine değiştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies

loans.name: Yicel Modesta

texts.es:
Yicel de 38 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, que estudian en primaria y secundaria. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. El Sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, queso, cuajada, crema. Esta joven madre se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios, por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para proporcionarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Gracias a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, frutas, fósforos, queso, cuajada. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Yicel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Yicel is 38 years old, married and has two underage children who are in primary and secondary school.  She is a native of Sauce a place located in the northern area of the region.  Sauce is known for being a producer of milk, cheese, curd and cream.  This young mother is known for being hardworking, responsible and eager to improve herself.  Unfortunately, she was not able to complete her education for lack of resources.  Currently, she fights day to day to provide her children with a better future.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she has a grocery business.  It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, fruit, matches, cheese and curd.  She dedicates about 12 hours a day to selling her products.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling edible products, so that in the near future she may increase her earnings.  Yicel is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide people of limited resources in poor countries, like Nicaragua, to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling food products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, fruit, matches, cheese and curd.

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek was born in 1976 and has a 15-year-old daughter. After she separated from her husband, she worked for many years to provide for herself and her daughter. About three years ago she found a sales company through her network and began selling from a catalog to earn money. Just selling from a catalog was difficult. She didn't have enough capital to buy products to show her customers. She heard about microcredit from a friend and wants to order 800 liras of products. She will buy clothes, cosmetics and textiles. Melek thought this would definitely be very helpful and make sales easier. In the future she wants a higher income so she can save for her daughter's future.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Melek Hanım 1976 doğumlu ve 15 yaşında bir kızı var.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra kızı ve kendisinin isteklerini karşılayabilmek için uzun yıllar çalışmış.  Yaklaşık 3 yıl önce network sistemi ile satış yapan firmalarla tanıştı.  3 yıldır katalog üzerinden satış yaparak para kazanmaya başladı.  Sadece katolog üzerinden satış yapmak haliyle zor oluyormuş.  Fakat ürün alıp müşterilerine göstermek için yeterli sermayesi yokmuş.  Bir arkadaşı sayesinde mikro krediden haberi olmuş ve 800 tl lik ürün getirterek çalışmaya başladı.  Çamaşır,kozmetik ve tekstil satıyor.  Kesinlikle çok faydası olduğunu düşünen melek hanım ürününü gösterince satışlarını daha kolay yaptığını söylüyor.  İleri de ki zamanlar da ise yükselerek gelirini de yükseltip çocuğunun geleceği için birikim yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, and textiles

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 51 years old, married, and they have been blessed with five children. She has a retail shop which she has been running for 13 years now and it has been profitable. 

She will be using the loan to buy additional goods for resale in her shop. These include sugar, rice as well as maize and wheat flour. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children by paying for their school fees and also buying a piece of land.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Justina's future hopes are to become a successful business lady and see that all her children live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of retail goods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis does farming in Kangundo town where he grows cash crops such as maize and beans to sell. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for two years and right now his monthly income from his business is 10,000 KES.

He will be using the loan to purchase water pipes to facilitate irrigation of his crops in his farm. This will enable him to get more produce. He will use the anticipated profits to save more money as well as to repay the loan. 

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his hopes in future are to become a large scale farmer and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en:
Nushaba is 52 years old, married, and has two daughters. Her husband is laborer. She works in a small market and sells different products (milk, sweets, butter, salt, rice, cookies, soaps, shampoo, washing powder, etc.). Her monthly income is 130 AZN.

Daily foods and other daily products are in high demand. People use them almost every day.  That’s why they run out of such products fast. It’s easier for people to buy products from little markets, because they are cheaper.

Nushaba wants to provide her daughters with a bright future. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy an assortment of products for her market and increase its income. This is her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products for her market

loans.name: Marlon Vladimir

texts.es:
Marlon de 25 años de edad, es un Joven con muchas aspiraciones, tiene una linda novia, pero aún no contrae matrimonio; su novia trabaja como contadora en una empresa de transporte público ubicada cerca de su vivienda. Marlon vive solo con su madre, ella pasa entretenida cuidando de una nieta que una hija le deja, pues  ella  trabaja y  no le queda tiempo para cuidarla.

Marlon ha trabajado en diferentes actividades, empezó como ayudante de albañil, luego trabajó en un taller de estructuras metálicas, en un taller eléctrico y muchos otros empleos. A partir del 2009 logró conseguir trabajo en una empresa de telefonía y se ha mantenido en este rubro económico. Actualmente trabaja ahí dedicándose a instalar cables y servicios de internet en las casas, el trabajo le queda a tan solo 10 minutos en motocicleta.

Marlon necesita el préstamo, porque desea cancelar una deuda que tiene con un conocido que le prestó el dinero, para que se comprar una motocicleta. El conocido le está exigiendo el dinero a Marlon, pero Marlon no tiene esa cantidad de dinero por el momento. Es por eso que ha solicitado el préstamo, pues desea salir de ese compromiso.

Marlon sueña con dejar de ser empleado y llegar a tener su propio taller eléctrico y de esta manera percibir mejores ingresos que lo motiven a formar un hogar y tener una buena familia.
texts.en:
Marlon is a 25-year-old young man with many aspirations.  He has a beautiful girlfriend, but they are not yet married.  His girlfriend works as a bookkeeper for a public transportation company that is located near her home.  Marlon lives alone with his mother.  She occupies herself by taking care of a granddaughter that one of her daughters leaves with her because she goes to work and cannot care for her.  

Marlon has worked in many different jobs.  He started out as a mason's assistant, he then worked in a metal workshop, an electric workshop and many other jobs.  In 2009, he was able to get a job in a telephone company, and he has since remained in this field.  He currently works installing cables and internet service in homes.  His job is only a 10 minute motorcycle ride away.

Marlon is in need of this loan because he wishes to pay off a debt that he has with an acquaintance who lent him money to purchase a motorcycle.  The acquaintance is demanding the money from Marlon, but Marlon does not have that amount of money at the moment.  For this reason, he is seeking the loan as he wants to get out of that commitment.  Marlon dreams of no longer being an employee, and someday having his own electrical workshop where he can earn a better living that will motivate him to build a home and have a nice family.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that he has with an acquaintance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his master's course.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine is a young Cameroonian aged thirty-one, married, and has four children.  Her oldest child is ten years old and in secondary school, and the youngest is two years old. 

She has been in this business for over eight months which makes her experienced. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will be used to buy items such as rice, soup, biscuits, bread, sugar, etc., that will increase her turn over by 25 percent.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, soup,  biscuits, bread, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan.
Desde hace 4 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside y, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes.
Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor.
Mariluz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a woman who is dedicated to her family and to her work. Her tenacity and perseverance has allowed her to progress, overcoming a variety of obstacles as they arose. Four years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon which is located in an area of the house she resides in. She also goes to clients homes on request. This has allowed her to generate the resources needed to support her husband with the financial burden of the household and cover the needs of her only son. 

Mariluz will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a hair dryer and wholesale supplies (scalp treatments, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish, etc.). Which will permit her to continue with her work and to offer a more complete service to her customers in a more flexible and efficient way. This will raise the profit margin that she receives for her labor. Mariluz says that her main wish is to continue her work, to solidify and strengthen her business to become more competitive in the market and therefore have the ability to offer her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Marilú Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marilú de 36 años de edad, hizo hasta noveno año de estudios secundarios, está felizmente casada, su esposo trabaja como motorista en un bus de servicio público interurbano, actualmente él no se encuentra trabajando pues tuvo problemas severos con una  gastritis y por lo tanto se encuentra bajo medicación en su casa, dejando así toda la responsabilidad familiar en su esposa.  Tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian, el pequeño va a 2do grado y el otro está en  primer año de bachillerato. Los cuatro viven juntos, en una casa que obtuvo familiarmente por herencia.

Marilú se dedica a vender ropa de forma ambulante. Ella hace los pedidos en distribuidoras mayoristas ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad. Inició esta actividad cuando nació su último hijo, pues ya eran más bocas que alimentar. Antes trabajaba en una venta de lácteos, pero no obtenía suficientes ingresos para aportar a su familia, es por eso que estando embarazada por segunda vez reflexionó y decidió que trabajaría en un negocio propio.

El préstamo solicitado, es para comprar más mercadería (ropa interior femenina y masculina, blusas, pantalones, shorts, etc.)  Pues es en esta época de verano donde la demanda crece y puede obtener buenas ganancias.

Marilú sueña con poder mejorar su vivienda,  donde puedan vivir de una forma más confortable. También aspira con incrementar su negocio, de manera que pueda tener un puesto fijo en el mercado y así poder darle a su familia y una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Marilú is 36 years old.  She studied until ninth grade.  She is happily married, and her husband works as a bus driver for a public intercity service.  Currently, he is not working because he had some severe problems with gastritis and has been at home under medication.  Therefore, she has taken all of the household responsibility.  She has two children who are in school.  The youngest is in second grade and the other one is in his first year of high school.  All four of them live together in a house that they inherited.

Marilú works selling clothing door-to-door.  She orders from large distributors located in the center of the city.  She started this business when her last child was born since they now had more mouths to feed.  Previously, she worked selling dairy products, but the earnings were not enough to support the family.  Therefore, when she was pregnant the second time, she reflected and decided to start her own business.

The loan she is seeking is to purchase more merchandise (men's and women's underwear, blouses, pants, shorts, etc.).  Now in the summer season, the demand increases and she can increase her earnings.  Marilú dreams of having a better home where they can live more comfortably.  She also aspires to expand her business so that she can have a fixed spot in the market, and in so doing, give her family a dignified quality of life.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise (women's and men's underwear, blouses, pants, shorts, etc.)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven emprendedora y visionaria, en su comunidad es conocida por ser carismática y servicial.
A sus 22 años de edad, desea iniciar su propio negocio, con el fin de autoemplearse y generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar.
Es por ello que, iniciará una papelería ubicada en un local cercano a una institución educativa, ventaja que le ayudaría para fortalecer su negocio desde el comienzo; ya cuenta con una fotocopiadora y una pequeña vitrina pero, le hace falta comprar una máquina plastificadora, una vitrina y surtido al por mayor (cuadernos, lapiceros, colores, borradores, cartulina, cinta adhesiva, entre otros productos de papelería), razón por la que solicita el apoyo del crédito, ya que, esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo, con el que espera lograr  buenos resultados a nivel de ventas y de ingresos personales.
Maribel tiene como propósito acreditar su negocio poco a poco y, en un futuro cercano desea ampliarlo para mejorar las ventas y la rentabilidad, así podrá ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
