Maribel is a young entrepreneur and visionary. In her community, she is known as being charismatic and obliging.
At the age of 22, she wants to start her own business. Her goal is to be self-employed and to generate an income to support her family.
For this reason, she is starting a stationery store close to an educational institution. The advantage of this location will help her to strengthen her business from the beginning. She already has a photocopier and a small display case, but she needs to buy a laminating machine, a display case, and wholesale stock (notebooks, pens, coloured pencils, erasers, poster board, tape, and other items). This is why she is requesting this loan; this will allow her to start her own business. With this, she hopes to achieve good sales results and make a good income.
Maribel plans to establish her business bit by bit. In the near future she wants to expand in order to improve her sales and profitability. This way, she will be able to offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a laminating machine, a display case, and wholesale stock (notebooks, pens, coloured pencils, erasers, posterboard, tape,and other stationery products.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 35 years old man from Kakamega and married to Pamela who is a business lady in the same town. They have four children ages 13, 8, 7, and 6.

He operates a retail shop business which he has done for the past 14 years earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES. He is taking his second loan of 30,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya which he intends to use in expanding his business. 

He will use the profits to reinvest back into the business and repay the loan. His dream is to become a wholesaler and give his family the best.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sacks of sugar, bails of flour, jericans of cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Angham Group

texts.en:
Angham Group is a four-member group. All of them are poor women from Sana`a, Yemen. Together, they applied for a YER 280,000 loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Fatema is a 58-year-old, married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and she is living in a poor area in Sana`a. 

Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to falling down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money. 

In order to complete the renovation, Fatema asked for a loan of YER 80,000 to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money, to improve the living conditions of her family and to open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to complete the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 25 years old, married and a father of two children ages one and three. He learnt about Vision Fund from a staff member. He has been advanced a first loan of 20,000 KES which will help him in the purchase of materials for making snacks. The snacks business earns Bernard a monthly income of 8,500 KES. He hopes to incorporate fruits sales in the stall from the proceeds of this loan.

His dream is to expand his business and to be able to provide his children with a higher education.

loans.use: to buy flour for baking snacks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is 39 years old and married with two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. He earns money by selling daily products (tea, sweets, sugar, water, lemonade, juice, salt, flour, etc.) in a small shop. He has been in this business for 19 years and has a monthly income of 300AZN. The food he sells is in high demand because people use the items every day for breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as for preparing food for guests (delicious dishes and desserts). Unfortunately, Habil’s monthly income is not enough to cover his family’s needs and to bring up his sons. He is planning to order more products for his small market to increase income. Therefore, Habil applied for a 1000AZN loan in order to expand his business. He hopes that he will be able to provide his sons with a good education.

loans.use: to order more products to sell in his market.

loans.name: Himoyat

texts.ru: Эту 63-летнюю пожилую женщину с города Вахдат зовут Химоят. Она жена, мать и бабушка. У нее доброе и отзывчивое сердце. Химоят любит животных. У нее при дворе дома имеется коровник, где она держит свою дойную корову, которая каждое утро дает ей молока. Химоят на старости лет решила начать животноводческий бизнес и превратить свое хобби в бизнес. Конечно в закупке и продаже скота ей будет помогать семья. Но за скотом она будет ухаживать сама. Так как начального капитала Химоят недостаточно для открытия такого бизнеса, она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита и сбережения она планирует закупить двух голов крупнорогатого скота и 180 кг жмыха. Она надеется, что в нее поверят и дадут ей шанс открыть свой бизнес.
texts.en: This 63-year-old elderly woman from the city of Vahdat is called Himoyat. She is a wife, a mother and a grandmother and has a kind and empathetic heart. Himoyat loves animals. She has a cow shed next to her home where she keeps her cow, which gives her milk every morning. In her old age, Himoyat has decided to start an animal husbandry business and to turn her hobby into a business. Of course, her family will help her to buy and sell the livestock, but she will take care of them herself. Since Himoyat doesn't have enough starting capital to open such a business, she needs a loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy two cows and 180 kg of oilcake for their feed. She hopes that you will believe in her and give her the change to begin her business.

loans.use: to buy two cows and 180 kg of feed, in order to start a business fattening cattle

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal is 44 years old, married and the father of one son. His wife is a housekeeper and he sells produce such as fruits and vegetables in a local market. Over the last 24 years, he has gained good experience working in this field and now earns a monthly income of 180 AZN. He knows that the poor people who live in his region really enjoy fresh produce, but can't afford the high prices charged by supermarkets because of their high costs and distant locations. That’s why they go to small markets such as the one Kamal runs. Unfortunately, however, his shop is very old, and that is why he has applied for a loan for 1,500 AZN to repair and improve conditions in his shop. He also wants to make his shop wider so that he can include some products that are in high demand. This is his second loan and he has a positive repayment and client history.

loans.use: to repair and improve his shop

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es reconocido en su comunidad por ser un hombre carismático, amable y trabajador; a sus 46 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente para brindar el sustento diario y solventar los gastos básicos de su grupo familiar.
En compañía de su madre, aprendió el oficio de la talabartería y, luego de haber obtenido experiencia y todos los conocimientos necesarios, decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller en un local arrendado; allí fabrica correas, bolsos, monturas, cabestros, estuches para celulares, entre otros, de esta forma satisface las necesidades y gustos de los habitantes de su pueblo, lo que le permite mejorar las ventas e ingresos que percibe con su labor.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar materia prima al por mayor (cuero, taches, pintura, hebillas y otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos, para mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
Carlos manifiesta que su propósito es adquirir un local propio para continuar con su labor y así hacer que su negocio sea más rentable, permitiendo generar una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is known in his neighbourhood for being a charismatic, kind, and hard-working man. At the age of 46, he is married with two children for whom he fights tirelessly in order to provide their daily bread and cover the family's basic costs.
From his mother, he learned leather crafting. Later, after having obtained experience and all the necessary knowledge, he decided to become independent and open his own workshop in a rented location. There he makes belts, purses, saddles, halters, cell phone cases, and other items. This way, he provides for the needs and likes of the residents of his village. This allows him to improve his sales and income from his work.
He is requesting a loan to help him buy basic materials wholesale (leather, studs, paint, buckles, and other items). This will allow him to continue with his work and offer a greater variety of products in order to improve his sales and income.
Carlos says that his goal is to acquire his own workshop to continue with his work and thus make his business more profitable. This will allow him to generate favourable economic stability in order to offer his children a quality education and in order to provide his entire family with a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic materials wholesale (leather, studs, paint, buckles, and other items).

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA  ont en moyenne 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO I l’un des quartiers   de la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
 Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, produits divers  et des grains.
 Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. MAMOU, 1ère femme à droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une douzaine de chemises, 25 pantalons, et 20 jupes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group DANAYA average 33 years of age and 5 children each all living in traditional extended families in SANTORO I, a district in SAN/SEGOU City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they have businesses buying and selling clothing, general goods, and grains. 

The women of the group DANAYA are on their first solidarity loan. MAMOU, who is the first woman at the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase a dozen shirts, 25 pants, and 20 skirts. She gets her supplies from Bamako. She makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women paying cash and sometimes with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, housing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Djiguifa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIFA  ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU dans la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
 Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, habillements et  grains.
 Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIFA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. AWA, 1ère femme debout à droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50Kgs d’ognon, 10 paquets de cube Maggi et 50Kgs de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne à sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group DJIGUIFA average 37 years of age and 5 children each all living in traditional extended families in LAFIABOUGOU, in SAN/SEGOU City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they have businesses buying and selling condiments, clothing, and grains. 

The women of the group DJIGUIFA are on their first solidarity loan. AWA, who is the first woman standing at the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of onions, 10 packets of Maggi [bouillon] cubes, and 50 kg of potatoes. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit to a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Hilol

texts.ru: Хилол умелая и искусная швея из города Душанбе. Ей 32 года. У нее высшее образование, но она никогда по своей специальности не работала. Хилол замужем и имеет троих сыновей. Ее муж работает в одной фирме. Сама Хилол три года назад начала швейное дело у себя дома. Так как ее с детства интересовало кройка и шитье, она самостоятельно научилась этой профессии. У нее имеются свои постоянные клиенты, которые пользуются только ее услугами. Хилол в данный момент хочет расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США для покупки компьютерной швейной машинки, с которой она будет работать быстрее, качественнее и к тому же сможет делать на платьях вышивки.
texts.en:
Hilol is an able and skilful seamstress of 32 from the city of Dushanbe. She has a high school education but has never worked in her specialty. Hilol is married and has three sons. Her husband works for a company, and Hilol started a sewing business three years ago that she runs out of her home. She taught herself this profession, as she has been interested in sewing since childhood. She now has regular clients who use her services exclusively. 

Hilol now wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a computerized sewing machine, with which she will be able to work more quickly and with better quality, and in addition will be able to add embroidery to dresses.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to help expand her sewing business

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKELEMA  ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU dans la ville de SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).    
 Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires et divers.
 Les femmes du groupe BENKELEMA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. AMI, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 75Kg de manioc et du bois de chauffe pour faire de l’atieké. Elle s’approvisionne à sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKELEMA average 35 years of age and 4 children each all living in traditional extended families in LAFIABOUGOU, in SAN/SEGOU City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they have businesses buying and selling grocery items and general merchandise. 

The women of the group BENKELEMA are on their first solidarity loan. AMI, who is the second woman from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 75 kg  of cassava and some firewood to make atieké [fermented cassava couscous]. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women paying cash and sometimes with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making atieké.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old, single and the mother of two children who are 28 and 27 years old. She is in the business of selling fruit in the town of Naivasha, where she has been in this line of work for eight years. She is requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy oranges, mangoes and other fruit to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits she earns to expand her business and pay school fees. In the near future, she hopes to be the top fruit seller in her area.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mangoes and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 32-year-old, married man. He has two children and he lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Mohammed has completed only secondary school and, due to lack of finances, he wasn't able to continue to study in the university. 

Mohammed has owned a taxi which used to provide his family`s expenses. He collected and saved an amount and he borrowed additional money from his relatives and friends in order to buy his taxi. 

Recently, his taxi stopped working well. He applied for a loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy spare parts to repair his taxi. 

Mohammed hopes to also own a retail shop, so that can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Marble is 55 years old, married and blessed with five children who are 5, 10, 15, 17 and 20 years old. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by running a mill. In an average month, she earns about KES 35,000. Marble is requesting a loan for KES. 50,000 to expand her business by buying more maize to grind and sell to her customers. This is her fourth loan and she has successfully repaid her three previous ones. She hopes and dreams of educating her children and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy maize to grind and sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, now 48 years old, used her previous loan to buy fertilizer and feed for her cattle. It was profitable and she has been able to pay back the loan well.

She will be using this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and feed for her cattle. This will enable her to get more produce, as well as income. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy more farm inputs.

This is Magdalena's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Magdalena's future hope is to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Islam is the featured borrower of the Star Group; she got joined with the other two members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Islam is a 37-year-old married mother of five children.  She has been working for 20 years raising goats to help her husband in making their living and covering their beloved family's needs.

Islam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a cow, which will increase her income and improve her family's living.

She is working hard to establish her own developed farm, which will improve her family's socioeconomic situation. She hopes to provide her children with the best education to make sure that they will benefit from a brighter future.

Islam is the first lady from the left with the green top. As for the other borrowers, Faten is the lady at the center, and Dalia is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children. She earns a living as a farmer in Kangundo town, where she grows cash crops such as maize and beans to sell. She also does poultry farming. Her husband earns additional income. She has been a farmer for four years and the monthly income from her business is KES. 20,000.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials to build a poultry shed. She needs timber, sheet metal, wire mesh and feeding troughs. She will use the profits she expects to earn from her expanded business to improve her family's living conditions. This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya; she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her hope for the future is to have a successful farming business, make more income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a poultry shed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and sells clothes. She is married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children who are grown up. Her spouse also provides additional income. She has been in the clothes selling business for five years, and right now her monthly income is KES 6,000.

She plans to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

This will enable her to make more income, and she will use the anticipated profits from her extended business to save more, and also buy a plot of land.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid back all her previous loans successfully. 

In future, Mary hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy another stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mobile phone, solar charging set and scale.

loans.name: Jennifer Paola

texts.es:
Paola es Una chica de 23 años tiene ya dos hijos un hermoso de 5 años y una princesa de tres años.

Ella no vive con los hijos, la vida ha sido un poco triste pero ha tratado de hacer lo mejor para salir adelante, ella en estos momentos vive con la pareja, una  persona que le está dando  ánimo para que salga adelante es la vida. El es paramédico y ella ahora decidió seguir los pasos de él y  seguir un camino junto para poder estar con las hijas. 

Ella es una chica demasiado alegre, bonita, amigable  y muy cumplidora, el  hijo es tierno y delicado, en cambio la hija es un poco mas difícil de tratar ya que es un poco mas inquieta que el hermano, siempre que están los tres ella se convierte en la mujer más feliz del mundo . 

A pesar de los malos ratos que ha tenido  levanta la cabeza y sigue hacia adelante con los pequeños pasos que ella puede dar, no es mucho pero su corazón es grande.  

Los padres no viven juntos,  y el padre no está con ella, la mama la ama y ella igual, pero tiene una relación muy distante y es algo triste, cuando paola la visita no quiere alejarse, ya que se va un poco triste para la casa.  

La pareja es su fuerza por las noches, ella saber que puede llegar a la casa y esta la pareja para poderla consolar o darle consejos, Paola es una persona muy sencilla, se le mide a lo que sea y no le da pena casi nada. 

Ya que paola decidió seguir los mismos pasos que la pareja, ella necesita el convenio de kiva para empezar a seguir el paso de la pareja y cumplir el sueño que ella tiene, el convenio sería una buena opción para ella, ya que tendría una mejora en la parte económica.
texts.en:
Paola is 23 and already has two children, a beautiful boy of 5 and a little princess aged 3. She doesn't live with her children - life has been a bit sad for her, but she has tried to do her best to get on. She is currently with her life partner, who is trying to encourage her to make a success of things. He is a paramedic and she decided to follow in his footsteps and take the same path in order to be with her children.

Paola is a very happy, pretty and friendly person who is very trustworthy. Her son is tender and delicate, whereas her daughter is a little more difficult to deal with as she is less calm than her brother. When all three are together, Paola becomes the happiest woman in the world. In spite of the bad moments she has lived through, she holds her head high and carries on making the small steps she can. It isn't much, but she has a big heart.

Her parents no longer live together, and her father is no longer with her mother. Paola's mother loves her, and she loves her mother, but the relationship is a bit distant and somewhat sad. When Paola visits her, she doesn't want to go away, because she leaves for home feeling a bit sad. Paola's partner is her strength at night time. She knows she can go home and he can console her or give her advice. She is a very simple person, she sees things how they are and hardly anything upsets her.

Since Paola decided to follow in her partner's footsteps, she needs a Kiva loan to begin to do this and achieve her dream. The loan would be a good option for her, as it would improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition fees.
